## Overview

This is a small bash script that automates [Google's webp converter](https://developers.google.com/speed/webp) to easily convert or deconvert all image files you have in a given folder to and from .webp files to supported formats.


## Instructions

1. Install Google's webp converter:

_Linux:_

```bash
sudo apt install webp
```

_Windows/MacOS:_

[Download from here](https://storage.googleapis.com/downloads.webmproject.org/releases/webp/index.html) and add the folder where you want to keep it to your PATH.

2. Give execute permission to the script:

_Linux:_
```bash
sudo chmod +x convert.sh
```
_MacOS:_
```bash
chmod 755 convert.sh
```

_Windows:_

```bash
Change the file extension to: convert.bat
```

3. Run the script in the same folder where your files are placed:


_Linux/MacOS_:

```bash
./convert.sh
```

_Windows_:
```bash
convert.bat
```

4. Select what you want to do: 

```bash
(decode/encode):  
decode
```

5. For encoding enter the current format:

```bash
Enter current format (.png/.jpg/.jpeg):
.png
```

6. For decoding enter the target format:

```bash
Enter current format (.png/.jpg/.jpeg):
.jpg
```

7. Enjoy!

__Note:__ Currently the script deletes the files after converting them, make sure to back your them up before running it! Also upported formats were not very clear in Google's documentation so I just have listed the ones I am sure the converter supports.
